greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest number whose square has exactly 2n+1 divisors.
comment: Only squares have an odd number of divisors.
example: a(4)=6 because it is the smallest number followed by 10,14,15,16,21,22,... whose squares have 2*4 + 1, i.e. 9 divisors.
program: (PARI) a(n) = {k = 1; while (numdiv(k^2) != (2*n+1), k++); return (k);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jul 27 2013
results.author: _Lekraj Beedassy_, May 31 2002
